verses.roman:
govindaṁ gṛham ānīya
deva-deveśam ādṛtaḥ
pūjāyāṁ nāvidat kṛtyaṁ
pramodopahato nṛpaḥ

synonyms: govindam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; gṛham—to His quarters; ānīya—bringing; deva—of all gods; deva-īśam—the Supreme God and controller; ādṛtaḥ—reverential; pūjāyām—in the ritual worship; na avidat—did not know; kṛtyam—the details of performance; pramoda—by his great joy; upahataḥ—overwhelmed; nṛpaḥ—the King.
translation: King Yudhiṣṭhira respectfully brought Lord Govinda, the Supreme God of gods, to his personal quarters. The King was so overcome with joy that he could not remember all the rituals of worship.

purport.content: Śrīla Prabhupāda writes, "As he brought Kṛṣṇa within the palace, King Yudhiṣṭhira became so confused in his jubilation that he practically forgot what he was to do at that time in order to receive Kṛṣṇa and worship Him properly."
